thread.section_title: Jose Mourinho ‘dreams’ of signing Alvaro Morata and Raphael Varane – Metro
thread.title: Jose Mourinho ‘dreams’ of signing Alvaro Morata and Raphael Varane
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho ‘dreams’ of signing Alvaro Morata and Raphael Varane

author: Chris Davie
title: Jose Mourinho ‘dreams’ of signing Alvaro Morata and Raphael Varane
text:
Alvaro Morata is wanted by Jose Mourinho, according to reports. (Power Sport Images/Getty Images) Jose Mourinho dreams of signing Real Madrid duo Alvaro Morata and Raphael Varane for Manchester United, according to reports in Spain.
Marca claim that David De Gea is Madrid’s first-choice target to replace Keylor Navas ahead of Thibaut Courtois and insist that bringing the Spain international to the Bernabeu this summer would not be an impossible task.
The report also suggests that Mourinho remains keen on Varane and Morata, though no approach has been made for either player.
Morata was wanted by Chelsea last summer but Antonio Conte failed with a £60 million bid to sign the striker from Juventus ahead of Real Madrid.
Raphael Varane remains on Mourinho’s radar. (Getty Images) More: Football Arsenal legend reveals the frustrating reason Gunners ALWAYS flop in Europe 
Chelsea on red alert as Koeman admits Everton could be forced to sell huge star 
Arsenal legend explains why Chelsea are nailed on to win the double 
It’s understood that Morata, who has started only nine La Liga games this season, remains on Chelsea’s shortlist ahead of the summer transfer window.
Varane, meanwhile, has been a long-term target of Mourinho, with reports in Spain claiming that the United boss held talks with the French centre-back last summer over a potential move to Old Trafford.
MORE: Anthony Martial not named in France’s latest squad as Monaco’s Kylian Mbappe earns first call-up 
MORE: Chelsea goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois aims thinly-veiled dig at Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho
